column5: If you still need a Pleasure Craft Operator Card, you may want to get on it asap. Effective April 15 the procedure for Internet testing will change, and and the number of questions on the exam will increase to 50.  It's still nothing more than a stupid cash grab, but if you need the card you may as well get it now before the test becomes longer, apparently a bit more difficult, and quite possibly a little more expensive.
Thanks Craig. I was thinking that most people would have them by now but I suppose there are new boaters every year and maybe some others who thought they'd try to get away with not having one.
Thanks for the heads up I am going to do mine this weekend, was saying I'm going to get it for a long time. Now I am going to actually get it. Thanks
Ive had mine since the early 90s and to this day ....i still dont know what a cordual buoy is supposed to represent...
He is the boy who greets you at the entrance to Walleye Mart with a bright smile.....

I hope they make it so you have to sit in a classroom for theory and on the water for practicle. Cash grab maybe worth while i think so. Have you ever seen somebody with a $200,000 dollar boat that hasnt got a clue its very scary.  Peter

get your GF's and friends to get it now, GF did hers last night. crap, she even scored better than i did, and I had been driving a boat for 20 years before I did my test. She doesn't even know how to start the boat.
on second thought now she is gonna be a back seat boater.... "Hey didn't you see that buouy don't you know what that means!!" AHHHHH
